io.spine.logging

Interface Logging

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Environment, Goes, MessageType, RejectionsFile, RejectionType, Required, SourceFile

    public interface Logging
    Utility interface for objects that require logging output.

    Such an object needs to implement this interface and obtain a FluentLogger instance associated with the class of the object via the logger() method.

    In addition to this, the interface provides shortcut methods for the popular logging interface methods. These shortcut methods are named after the tracing level of Java Logging (such as _fine() or _severe(), and aliases for the levels popular from other logging frameworks (such as _debug() or _error().

    API Note:
    The underscore-based convention is selected for making logging calls more visible and distinguishable from the real code.

      static java.util.logging.Level errorLevel()
      Returns Level.SEVERE as the convention for logging errors.
      default com.google.common.flogger.FluentLogger logger()
      Obtains FluentLogger instance for this class.
      static com.google.common.flogger.FluentLogger loggerFor(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
      Obtains FluentLogger instance for the given class.
